tuv.seg: How your income tax is calculated
An córas le cáin a mheas
Tax on income you earn from employment is deducted directly from your salary (pay)
Cur síos ar an gcóras nua creidhmheasanna cánacha
Universal Social Charge (USC)
Muirear Sóisialta Uilíoch (MSU)
The Universal Social Charge is a tax payable on gross income that came into effect on 1 January 2011
Is cáin é an Muirear Sóisialta Uilíoch (MSU) iníoctha ar ioncam comhlán a tháinig i bhfeidhm an 1 Eanáir 2011
Online services for PAYE taxpayers
Seirbhísí ar líne do cháiníocóirí ÍMAT
You can use the PAYE Anytime service or the Jobs and Pensions service from Revenue to manage your tax if you are a PAYE taxpayer
Cuimsíonn siad seo seirbhísí a ligeann duit amharc ar do thaifead cánach, d’fhaisnéis phearsanta a nuashonrú agus creidmheasanna cánach agus faoiseamh a éileamh
Taxation of married people and civil partners
Gearradh cánach ar dhaoine pósta in Éirinn
There are three ways in which you can be taxed as a married person
Tá trí bhealach inar féidir cáin a ghearradh ort mar dhuine pósta in Éirinn
Explore the options and find out how to apply
Déan iniúchadh ar na roghanna agus faigh amach cén chaoi iarratas a dhéanamh
Taxation of benefits from employment
Cáin ar shochair ón bhfostaíocht
Employees can get certain benefits in addition to their salary or wages. Some of these benefits are taxed. This document provides information on how such benefits are taxed
Tá cur síos sa cháipéis seo ar na príomhshochair gur féidir le fostaí a fháil sa bhreis ar a t(h)uarastal/pá agus conas a ngearrtar cáin ar na sochair sin
Artist's exemption from income tax
Díolúine ó cháin iomcaim ag ealaíontóirí
Some income earned by artists, writers, sculpturs and painters in Ireland from the sale of their work may be exempt from income tax
D'fhéadfadh ioncam a thuilleann ealaíontóirí, scríbhneoirí, dealbhóirí agus péintéirí in Éirinn ón gcuid saothair a bheith díolmhaithe ó cháin ioncaim
How to obtain exemption from income tax if you are an artist and satisfy certain criteria
Faigh amach conas díolúine a fháil ó cháin ioncaim más ealaíontóir tú
PAYE overpayments and underpayments of tax
Ró-íocaíochtaí agus gearríocaíochtaí cánach ÍMAT
This document explains how you can find out if you have underpaid or overpaid tax
Míníonn an doiciméad seo conas is féidir leat a fháil amach an bhfuil tú tar éis ró-íocaíocht nó gearríocaíocht cánach a dhéanamh
It also explains how to get a refund of tax or pay tax you may owe
Míníonn sé freisin conas aisíoc cánach a fháil nó cáin atá le n-íoc agat a íoc
Taxation of social welfare payments
Gearradh cánach ar íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh
Social welfare payments may or may not be deemed taxable in Ireland
Bíodh sin mar atá, d'fhéadfadh d'íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh a bheith inchánaithe nó saor ó cháin in Éirinn
Information about how which social welfare payments are taxable and how they are taxed
Faigh amach na rialacha canachais na n-íocaíochtaí leasa shóisialaigh
This document is in: Social Welfare > Irish social welfare system > Claiming a social welfare payment
This document is in: Leas Sóisialach > Córas Leasa Shóisialaigh na hÉireann > Íocaíocht Leasa Shóisialaigh a Éileamh
Tax and starting work - PAYE
Cáin agus tosú ar obair
Most employees have their tax deducted from their salary by their employer
Is é an fostóir a asbhaineann cáin as tuarastal fhormhór na bhfostaithe
Find out what you need to know about tax when starting work
Faigh amach an méid a chaithfidh a bheith ar eolas agat faoi cháin nuair a thosaíonn tú ag obair
This document is in: Employment > Starting work and changing job > Starting work
This document is in: Fostaíocht > Tosú ag obair agus athrú jabanna > Tosú ag obair
Changing job: tax, PRSI and pension
Athrú poist: cáin, ÁSPC agus pinsean
There are various steps to be taken when changing job, particularly in relation to tax, social insurance (PRSI) and pension
Tá céimeanna éagsúla ann le glacadh le linn athrú poist maidir le cáin, ÁSPC agus pinsean
This document is in: Employment > Starting work and changing job > Changing job
This document is in: Fostaíocht > Tosú ag obair agus athrú jabanna > Athrú jabanna
Taxation of lump sum payment on redundancy or retirement
Cáin ar chnapshuim iomarcaíochta nó scoir
Lump sum payments in compensation for loss of employment are subject to tax
Tá cur síos anseo ar an gcóras le cáin a ghearradh ar chúiteamh a íoctar ina chnapshuim nuair a chailltear fostaíocht
How is tax calculated and what are your entitlements?
Conas a mheastar an cháin agus cad é do theidlíochtaí?
This document is in: Employment > Retirement > Income Tax in Retirement
This document is in: Fostaíocht > Dul ar scor > Cáin ioncaim do lucht pinsin
Tax refund when unemployed or out of work sick
Cóid chánach agus páirtnéireacht shibhialta
Explanation of how to get a tax refund if you have worked and are now unemployed or out of work due to illness
Tá fáil anois ar na forálacha cánach a bhaineann le lanúineacha pósta ag páirtnéirí sibhialta
How to comply with your tax obligations
Conas do dhualgais chánach a chomhlíonadh
Some PAYE taxpayers have other sources of income
Some PAYE taxpayers have other sources of income
Information about how non-PAYE income is taxed
Information about how non-PAYE income is taxed
Tax codes and civil partnership
Is cáin ar do chuid ioncaim é an tobhach ioncaim
The tax provisions that apply to married couples are now available to civil partners
Go ginearálta, bíonn an méid atá dlite ort ag brath ar an bpá a thuilleann tú
Find out more about how civil partners are treated under the tax code
Faigh tuilleadh eolais ar an mbealach a ghearrtar tobhach ar do chuid ioncaim

Ábhar is mó éilimh i "Airgead agus Cáin"
